get into the stitch-mas spirit with a quick and festive make! the **wheat stitch crochet wreath** pattern transforms two simple rectangles worked in my **[signature wheat stitch™][1]** into a beautifully textured holiday wreath — perfect for decorating your home, gifting to neighbors, or adding handmade charm to your christmas décor.

make a classic green wreath… or go bold with unexpected color combinations! with four sizes to choose from, these wreaths make adorable wall décor, mantle accents, door ornaments, or even holiday table decorations. if you enjoy fast holiday crochet patterns that look better than store-bought, this one’s knot your average wreath.

[a video tutorial is included in the pattern.][2]

**crochet hook:** 
[g+/7 (4.5mm) - or size to meet gauge][3]

**notions:**
[removable stitch markers][4] 
[yarn needle to weave in ends][5] 
[scissors][6]
[wreath forms (4.5, 7.5, 11)"][7]
[16” wreath form][8]

**yarn:**
[wecrochet brava tweed][9]
97% premium acrylic/3% viscose 218yds/100g

**yarn quantities:**
wreath 50 (120, 240, 395) yds 
bow 45 (120, 275, 445) yds

**yarn substitutions:**
 [lion brand heartland][10] - 100% acrylic; 251yds/142g

[herrschners worsted 8 heathers][11] - 100% acrylic; 489yds/226g

[mary maxim maximum value][12] - 100% acrylic; 474yds/227g

[herrschners supreme worsted][13] - 100% acrylic; 169yds/100g

[herrschners worsted sparkle][14] - 92% acrylic/8% polyester; 489yds/226g

**abbreviations:**
blo- back loop only
ch - chain
rs - right side
sc - single crochet
sl st - slip stitch
st(s) - stitch(es)
ws - wrong side

**gauge:**
not critical for this design.
15 sts by 13 rows = 4" by 4" in stitch pattern

not sure what gauge is? check out this blog post:  [what is crochet gauge and how to fix it][15]

**sizes:**
 4 sizes -xs to large

**skill level:**
advanced beginner
